Job Title: Executive Director - LNHA

Location: Apopka, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Overview

Located on approximately 10 acres of land adjacent to Florida Hospital, Apopka Health and Rehabilitation Center is designed with a split floor plan to provide resident privacy. The 101,811 square foot center includes 36 private and the 72 semi-private well-appointed suites. All resident rooms have individual bathrooms, each with its own shower. Enclosed exterior courtyards feature multiple access points and plenty of shaded areas to maximize resident comfort and relaxation. A large state-of-the-art therapy gym opens onto a courtyard featuring an occupational therapy track or mobility garden. Residents enjoy daily activities in addition to an on-site movie cinema.

Responsibilities

 Executive Director - Licensed Nursing Home Administrator 

This is a wonderful opportunity for a compelling and dynamic individual with a proven ability to drive innovation and growth. The ideal candidate is a thought leader who can inspire others through living our mission.

Apopka Health & Rehab is seeking an experienced Executive Director to lead our family of staff and residents. Our 180-bed skilled nursing facility, built just 3.5 years, is looking for an Executive Director to provide hands-on leadership, strategic guidance, and manage all aspects of facility operations while creating a culture of person-centered care while delivering outstanding financial results.

Expertise

 Strong focus on patient safety, quality, compliance performance in parallel with effective operational, financial, business development and strategic planning skills.  Strong track record of demonstrated success and profitability in a Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF).  Demonstrates a high level of market acumen.  Understands SNF performance metrics and clearly articulates areas of focus for performance improvement.  Develops and manages a team of high performing leaders.  Serves as a positive role model and mentors.  Excellent communication abilities. Sets clear expectations and holds team accountable for results. 

Benefits

What's in it for you?

 Medical , dental, vision and life insurance  Generous Paid Time and Holiday Pay  Robust Tuition Assistance Program  401k with Excellent Company Match 
Qualifications

 Must be a Skilled Licensed Nursing Home Administrator, in good standing in our state  Minimum of 3 years of experience serving as an LNHA in a Skilled Nursing Environment  Proven track record of leading staff to provide superior quality care  We are a vaccinated care facility. New hires will need to provide proof of vaccination or other acceptable documents prior to starting employment 

Come join our family where our team members dedicate themselves to love without limits and where they live by the standards of our safety-first, family always philosophy

 Click Apply to join us! 

Go to our website for more info and career opportunities www.ablehearts.org/careers

Experience Level (if available): Executive
